name: My Tarot Deck
author: Your Name
description: A custom tarot deck with 78 cards

cards.name: The Fool
cards.meaningUpright: New beginnings, innocence, spontaneity, a free spirit
cards.meaningReversed: Holding back, recklessness, risk-taking
cards.description: The Fool represents new beginnings and having faith in the future.

cards.name: The Magician
cards.meaningUpright: Manifestation, resourcefulness, power, inspired action
cards.meaningReversed: Manipulation, poor planning, untapped talents
cards.description: The Magician represents the power to manifest your desires.

cards.name: The High Priestess
cards.meaningUpright: Intuition, sacred knowledge, divine feminine, the subconscious mind
cards.meaningReversed: Secrets, disconnected from intuition, withdrawal
cards.description: The High Priestess represents intuition and inner knowledge.

cards.name: The Empress
cards.meaningUpright: Femininity, beauty, nature, nurturing, abundance
cards.meaningReversed: Creative block, dependence on others
cards.description: The Empress represents fertility, beauty, and abundance.

cards.name: The Emperor
cards.meaningUpright: Authority, establishment, structure, a father figure
cards.meaningReversed: Domination, excessive control, lack of discipline
cards.description: The Emperor represents authority, structure, and stability.

cards.name: The Hierophant
cards.meaningUpright: Spiritual wisdom, religious beliefs, conformity, tradition
cards.meaningReversed: Personal beliefs, freedom, challenging the status quo
cards.description: The Hierophant represents spiritual wisdom and tradition.

cards.name: The Lovers
cards.meaningUpright: Love, harmony, relationships, values alignment, choices
cards.meaningReversed: Self-love, disharmony, imbalance, misalignment of values
cards.description: The Lovers represents relationships and choices.

cards.name: The Chariot
cards.meaningUpright: Control, willpower, success, action, determination
cards.meaningReversed: Self-discipline, opposition, lack of direction
cards.description: The Chariot represents willpower and determination.

cards.name: Strength
cards.meaningUpright: Strength, courage, persuasion, influence, compassion
cards.meaningReversed: Inner strength, self-doubt, low energy, raw emotion
cards.description: Strength represents inner power and courage.

cards.name: The Hermit
cards.meaningUpright: Soul-searching, introspection, being alone, inner guidance
cards.meaningReversed: Isolation, loneliness, withdrawal
cards.description: The Hermit represents introspection and inner guidance.

cards.name: Wheel of Fortune
cards.meaningUpright: Good luck, karma, life cycles, destiny, a turning point
cards.meaningReversed: Bad luck, resistance to change, breaking cycles
cards.description: The Wheel of Fortune represents cycles and destiny.

cards.name: Justice
cards.meaningUpright: Justice, fairness, truth, cause and effect, law
cards.meaningReversed: Unfairness, lack of accountability, dishonesty
cards.description: Justice represents fairness and truth.

cards.name: The Hanged Man
cards.meaningUpright: Pause, surrender, letting go, new perspectives
cards.meaningReversed: Delays, resistance, stalling, indecision
cards.description: The Hanged Man represents surrender and new perspectives.

cards.name: Death
cards.meaningUpright: Endings, change, transformation, transition
cards.meaningReversed: Resistance to change, personal transformation, inner purging
cards.description: Death represents transformation and endings.

cards.name: Temperance
cards.meaningUpright: Balance, moderation, patience, purpose
cards.meaningReversed: Imbalance, excess, self-healing, re-alignment
cards.description: Temperance represents balance and moderation.

cards.name: The Devil
cards.meaningUpright: Shadow self, attachment, addiction, restriction, sexuality
cards.meaningReversed: Releasing limiting beliefs, exploring dark thoughts, detachment
cards.description: The Devil represents bondage and materialism.

cards.name: The Tower
cards.meaningUpright: Sudden change, upheaval, chaos, revelation, awakening
cards.meaningReversed: Personal transformation, fear of change, averting disaster
cards.description: The Tower represents sudden change and upheaval.

cards.name: The Star
cards.meaningUpright: Hope, faith, purpose, renewal, spirituality
cards.meaningReversed: Lack of faith, despair, self-trust, disconnection
cards.description: The Star represents hope and inspiration.

cards.name: The Moon
cards.meaningUpright: Illusion, fear, anxiety, subconscious, intuition
cards.meaningReversed: Release of fear, repressed emotion, inner confusion
cards.description: The Moon represents illusion and the subconscious.

cards.name: The Sun
cards.meaningUpright: Positivity, fun, warmth, success, vitality
cards.meaningReversed: Inner child, feeling down, overly optimistic
cards.description: The Sun represents joy and success.

cards.name: Judgement
cards.meaningUpright: Judgement, rebirth, inner calling, absolution
cards.meaningReversed: Self-doubt, inner critic, ignoring the call
cards.description: Judgement represents reflection and reckoning.

cards.name: The World
cards.meaningUpright: Completion, integration, accomplishment, travel
cards.meaningReversed: Seeking personal closure, short-cuts, delays
cards.description: The World represents completion and accomplishment.

cards.name: Ace of Wands
cards.meaningUpright: Inspiration, new opportunities, growth, potential
cards.meaningReversed: An emerging idea, lack of direction, distractions, delays
cards.description: The Ace of Wands represents new creative beginnings.

cards.name: Two of Wands
cards.meaningUpright: Future planning, progress, decisions, discovery
cards.meaningReversed: Personal goals, inner alignment, fear of unknown
cards.description: The Two of Wands represents planning and decisions.

cards.name: Three of Wands
cards.meaningUpright: Progress, expansion, foresight, overseas opportunities
cards.meaningReversed: Playing small, lack of foresight, unexpected delays
cards.description: The Three of Wands represents expansion and foresight.

cards.name: Four of Wands
cards.meaningUpright: Celebration, joy, harmony, relaxation, homecoming
cards.meaningReversed: Personal celebration, inner harmony, conflict with others
cards.description: The Four of Wands represents celebration and harmony.

cards.name: Five of Wands
cards.meaningUpright: Conflict, disagreements, competition, tension, diversity
cards.meaningReversed: Inner conflict, conflict avoidance, releasing tension
cards.description: The Five of Wands represents conflict and competition.

cards.name: Six of Wands
cards.meaningUpright: Success, public recognition, progress, self-confidence
cards.meaningReversed: Private achievement, personal definition of success, fall from grace
cards.description: The Six of Wands represents victory and recognition.

cards.name: Seven of Wands
cards.meaningUpright: Challenge, competition, protection, perseverance
cards.meaningReversed: Exhaustion, giving up, overwhelmed
cards.description: The Seven of Wands represents standing your ground.

cards.name: Eight of Wands
cards.meaningUpright: Movement, fast paced change, action, alignment, air travel
cards.meaningReversed: Delays, frustration, resisting change, internal alignment
cards.description: The Eight of Wands represents swift action and movement.

cards.name: Nine of Wands
cards.meaningUpright: Resilience, courage, persistence, test of faith, boundaries
cards.meaningReversed: Inner resources, struggle, overwhelm, defensive
cards.description: The Nine of Wands represents resilience and persistence.

cards.name: Ten of Wands
cards.meaningUpright: Burden, extra responsibility, hard work, completion
cards.meaningReversed: Doing it all, carrying the burden, delegation, release
cards.description: The Ten of Wands represents burden and responsibility.

cards.name: Page of Wands
cards.meaningUpright: Inspiration, ideas, discovery, limitless potential, free spirit
cards.meaningReversed: Newly-formed ideas, redirecting energy, self-limiting beliefs
cards.description: The Page of Wands represents enthusiasm and exploration.

cards.name: Knight of Wands
cards.meaningUpright: Energy, passion, inspired action, adventure, impulsiveness
cards.meaningReversed: Passion project, haste, scattered energy, delays, frustration
cards.description: The Knight of Wands represents action and adventure.

cards.name: Queen of Wands
cards.meaningUpright: Courage, confidence, independence, social butterfly, determination
cards.meaningReversed: Self-respect, self-confidence, introverted, re-establish sense of self
cards.description: The Queen of Wands represents confidence and determination.

cards.name: King of Wands
cards.meaningUpright: Natural-born leader, vision, entrepreneur, honour
cards.meaningReversed: Impulsiveness, haste, ruthless, high expectations
cards.description: The King of Wands represents leadership and vision.

cards.name: Ace of Cups
cards.meaningUpright: Love, new relationships, compassion, creativity
cards.meaningReversed: Self-love, intuition, repressed emotions
cards.description: The Ace of Cups represents new emotional beginnings.

cards.name: Two of Cups
cards.meaningUpright: Unified love, partnership, mutual attraction
cards.meaningReversed: Self-love, break-ups, disharmony, distrust
cards.description: The Two of Cups represents partnership and unity.

cards.name: Three of Cups
cards.meaningUpright: Celebration, friendship, creativity, collaborations
cards.meaningReversed: Independence, alone time, hard work, excess
cards.description: The Three of Cups represents celebration and friendship.

cards.name: Four of Cups
cards.meaningUpright: Meditation, contemplation, apathy, reevaluation
cards.meaningReversed: Retreat, withdrawal, checking in for alignment
cards.description: The Four of Cups represents contemplation and apathy.

cards.name: Five of Cups
cards.meaningUpright: Regret, failure, disappointment, pessimism
cards.meaningReversed: Personal setbacks, self-forgiveness, moving on
cards.description: The Five of Cups represents loss and disappointment.

cards.name: Six of Cups
cards.meaningUpright: Revisiting the past, childhood memories, innocence, joy
cards.meaningReversed: Living in the past, forgiveness, lacking playfulness
cards.description: The Six of Cups represents nostalgia and childhood.

cards.name: Seven of Cups
cards.meaningUpright: Opportunities, choices, wishful thinking, illusion
cards.meaningReversed: Alignment, personal values, overwhelmed by choices
cards.description: The Seven of Cups represents choices and fantasy.

cards.name: Eight of Cups
cards.meaningUpright: Disappointment, abandonment, withdrawal, escapism
cards.meaningReversed: Trying one more time, indecision, aimless drifting
cards.description: The Eight of Cups represents walking away.

cards.name: Nine of Cups
cards.meaningUpright: Contentment, satisfaction, gratitude, wish come true
cards.meaningReversed: Inner happiness, materialism, dissatisfaction
cards.description: The Nine of Cups represents satisfaction and wishes fulfilled.

cards.name: Ten of Cups
cards.meaningUpright: Divine love, blissful relationships, harmony, alignment
cards.meaningReversed: Disconnection, misaligned values, struggling relationships
cards.description: The Ten of Cups represents emotional fulfillment and family.

cards.name: Page of Cups
cards.meaningUpright: Creative opportunities, intuitive messages, curiosity, possibility
cards.meaningReversed: New ideas, doubting intuition, creative blocks, emotional immaturity
cards.description: The Page of Cups represents creativity and intuition.

cards.name: Knight of Cups
cards.meaningUpright: Creativity, romance, charm, imagination, beauty
cards.meaningReversed: Overactive imagination, unrealistic, jealousy, moodiness
cards.description: The Knight of Cups represents romance and charm.

cards.name: Queen of Cups
cards.meaningUpright: Compassionate, caring, emotionally stable, intuitive, in flow
cards.meaningReversed: Inner feelings, self-care, self-love, co-dependency
cards.description: The Queen of Cups represents compassion and emotional security.

cards.name: King of Cups
cards.meaningUpright: Emotionally balanced, compassionate, diplomatic
cards.meaningReversed: Self-compassion, inner feelings, moodiness, emotionally manipulative
cards.description: The King of Cups represents emotional balance and generosity.

cards.name: Ace of Swords
cards.meaningUpright: Breakthroughs, new ideas, mental clarity, success
cards.meaningReversed: Inner clarity, re-thinking an idea, clouded judgement
cards.description: The Ace of Swords represents mental clarity and breakthroughs.

cards.name: Two of Swords
cards.meaningUpright: Difficult decisions, weighing up options, an impasse, avoidance
cards.meaningReversed: Indecision, confusion, information overload, no right choice
cards.description: The Two of Swords represents difficult decisions.

cards.name: Three of Swords
cards.meaningUpright: Heartbreak, emotional pain, sorrow, grief, hurt
cards.meaningReversed: Negative self-talk, releasing pain, optimism, forgiveness
cards.description: The Three of Swords represents heartbreak and sorrow.

cards.name: Four of Swords
cards.meaningUpright: Rest, relaxation, meditation, contemplation, recuperation
cards.meaningReversed: Exhaustion, burn-out, deep contemplation, stagnation
cards.description: The Four of Swords represents rest and recuperation.

cards.name: Five of Swords
cards.meaningUpright: Conflict, disagreements, competition, defeat, winning at all costs
cards.meaningReversed: Reconciliation, making amends, past resentment
cards.description: The Five of Swords represents conflict and defeat.

cards.name: Six of Swords
cards.meaningUpright: Transition, change, rite of passage, releasing baggage
cards.meaningReversed: Personal transition, resistance to change, unfinished business
cards.description: The Six of Swords represents transition and moving on.

cards.name: Seven of Swords
cards.meaningUpright: Betrayal, deception, getting away with something, acting strategically
cards.meaningReversed: Imposter syndrome, self-deceit, keeping secrets
cards.description: The Seven of Swords represents deception and strategy.

cards.name: Eight of Swords
cards.meaningUpright: Negative thoughts, self-imposed restriction, imprisonment, victim mentality
cards.meaningReversed: Self-limiting beliefs, inner critic, releasing negative thoughts
cards.description: The Eight of Swords represents restriction and helplessness.

cards.name: Nine of Swords
cards.meaningUpright: Anxiety, worry, fear, depression, nightmares
cards.meaningReversed: Inner turmoil, deep-seated fears, secrets, releasing worry
cards.description: The Nine of Swords represents anxiety and worry.

cards.name: Ten of Swords
cards.meaningUpright: Painful endings, deep wounds, betrayal, loss, crisis
cards.meaningReversed: Recovery, regeneration, resisting an inevitable end
cards.description: The Ten of Swords represents endings and defeat.

cards.name: Page of Swords
cards.meaningUpright: New ideas, curiosity, thirst for knowledge, new ways of communicating
cards.meaningReversed: Self-expression, all talk and no action, haphazard action, haste
cards.description: The Page of Swords represents curiosity and new ideas.

cards.name: Knight of Swords
cards.meaningUpright: Ambitious, action-oriented, driven to succeed, fast-thinking
cards.meaningReversed: Restless, unfocused, impulsive, burn-out
cards.description: The Knight of Swords represents ambition and action.

cards.name: Queen of Swords
cards.meaningUpright: Independent, unbiased judgement, clear boundaries, direct communication
cards.meaningReversed: Overly-emotional, easily influenced, bitchy, cold-hearted
cards.description: The Queen of Swords represents clarity and independence.

cards.name: King of Swords
cards.meaningUpright: Mental clarity, intellectual power, authority, truth
cards.meaningReversed: Quiet power, inner truth, misuse of power, manipulation
cards.description: The King of Swords represents intellectual power and authority.

cards.name: Ace of Pentacles
cards.meaningUpright: A new financial or career opportunity, manifestation, abundance
cards.meaningReversed: Lost opportunity, lack of planning and foresight
cards.description: The Ace of Pentacles represents new financial beginnings.

cards.name: Two of Pentacles
cards.meaningUpright: Multiple priorities, time management, prioritization, adaptability
cards.meaningReversed: Over-committed, disorganization, reprioritization
cards.description: The Two of Pentacles represents balance and adaptability.

cards.name: Three of Pentacles
cards.meaningUpright: Teamwork, collaboration, learning, implementation
cards.meaningReversed: Disharmony, misalignment, working alone
cards.description: The Three of Pentacles represents teamwork and collaboration.

cards.name: Four of Pentacles
cards.meaningUpright: Saving money, security, conservatism, scarcity, control
cards.meaningReversed: Over-spending, greed, self-protection
cards.description: The Four of Pentacles represents security and control.

cards.name: Five of Pentacles
cards.meaningUpright: Financial loss, poverty, lack mindset, isolation, worry
cards.meaningReversed: Recovery from financial loss, spiritual poverty
cards.description: The Five of Pentacles represents hardship and loss.

cards.name: Six of Pentacles
cards.meaningUpright: Giving, receiving, sharing wealth, generosity, charity
cards.meaningReversed: Self-care, unpaid debts, one-sided charity
cards.description: The Six of Pentacles represents generosity and sharing.

cards.name: Seven of Pentacles
cards.meaningUpright: Long-term view, sustainable results, perseverance, investment
cards.meaningReversed: Lack of long-term vision, limited success or reward
cards.description: The Seven of Pentacles represents patience and investment.

cards.name: Eight of Pentacles
cards.meaningUpright: Apprenticeship, repetitive tasks, mastery, skill development
cards.meaningReversed: Self-development, perfectionism, misdirected activity
cards.description: The Eight of Pentacles represents dedication and craftsmanship.

cards.name: Nine of Pentacles
cards.meaningUpright: Abundance, luxury, self-sufficiency, financial independence
cards.meaningReversed: Self-worth, over-investment in work, hustling
cards.description: The Nine of Pentacles represents abundance and independence.

cards.name: Ten of Pentacles
cards.meaningUpright: Wealth, financial security, family, long-term success, contribution
cards.meaningReversed: The dark side of wealth, financial failure or loss
cards.description: The Ten of Pentacles represents wealth and legacy.

cards.name: Page of Pentacles
cards.meaningUpright: Manifestation, financial opportunity, skill development
cards.meaningReversed: Lack of progress, procrastination, learn from failure
cards.description: The Page of Pentacles represents opportunity and study.

cards.name: Knight of Pentacles
cards.meaningUpright: Hard work, productivity, routine, conservatism
cards.meaningReversed: Self-discipline, boredom, feeling stuck, perfectionism
cards.description: The Knight of Pentacles represents hard work and routine.

cards.name: Queen of Pentacles
cards.meaningUpright: Nurturing, practical, providing financially, a working parent
cards.meaningReversed: Financial independence, self-care, work-home conflict
cards.description: The Queen of Pentacles represents nurturing and practicality.

cards.name: King of Pentacles
cards.meaningUpright: Wealth, business, leadership, security, discipline, abundance
cards.meaningReversed: Financially inept, obsessed with wealth and status, stubborn
cards.description: The King of Pentacles represents wealth and business success.
